intro: Stilpnopappus rufulus, commonly known as the roughleaf sunflower, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, hairy stems. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its leaves are rough and grayish-green, with a distinctive pubescent texture, and its yellow flowers bloom in late summer. The plant is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
